alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Dubois; Orange; Washington (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 7:24AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Dubois, Crawford, Orange and southwestern Washington Counties through 745 AM EDT... At 716 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms over the Wabash River, moving east at 45 mph. These storms will be moving in over the 90 minutes. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will be moving into and bring a burst of heavy rain, lightning and hail. Warnings are possible for hail if they maintain their intensity. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of Crawford, Orange, southwestern Washington and Dubois Counties, including the following locations... Hillham, Celestine, Millersport, Bretzville, Chambersburg, Bacon, Birdseye, French Lick, Syria and Curby. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
